title: 2 Drivers Arrested For DWI In Separate Crashes In Hoboken
description: Drivers were arrested for DWI after car accidents in Hoboken two days in a row.
content:
On June 28, around 6 p.m., Police Officer Valentino Salgado was on patrol on the 200 block of Willow Avenue when he heard a loud bang, police said. He realized it was a crash and approached two vehicles that were involved. One had heavy damage to the right rear fender, police said. The second vehicle, determined to be the striking vehicle, was located at the intersection of First Street and Willow Avenue, police said.

Salgado said he observed the driver, Bailee Zimmerman, 33, of Jersey City, speaking very slowly, with delayed actions. An on-scene investigation determined that Zimmerman struck a parked vehicle, drove away, and attempted to turn the wrong way down First Street, police said.

Police gave her a standardized field sobriety test and arrested Zimmerman for driving while intoxicated. At headquarters, she was given summonses for reckless driving and leaving the scene of an accident. As per John’s Law, Zimmerman was released into the custody of a responsible party.

John's Law was instituted in New Jersey in 2001 after a man was charged with DWI and then released into the custody of a friend. The friend took him to his vehicle, according to the state. The arrested man then collided with another car, killing the driver, John Elliott, who was an ensign in the Navy.



Early the next morning, June 29, around 3:50 a.m., police responded to the 1100 block of Grand Street on reports of a car flipped over. Police said Karol Bacuilima, 29, of Jersey City, was driving at a high rate of speed when she struck a parked vehicle and filpped over.

 "Officers observed the driver to have the odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath," police said. "She also appeared to be unsteady on her feet, have glassy eyes, and slurred speech." After a field sobriety test was conducted, Bacuilima was arrested for driving while intoxicated. She was also issued summonses for driving while intoxicated, failure to exhibit insurance, reckless driving, and refusal to submit to breath samples.

taxonomies.name: /Autos & Vehicles/Vehicle Codes & Driving Laws/Drunk Driving Law

summary: Two drivers were arrested for DWI in separate incidents in Hoboken, New Jersey, on June 28 and 29. Police Officer Valentino Salgado was on patrol when he witnessed a crash involving two vehicles. Bailee Zimmerman, 33, of Jersey City, was arrested for driving while intoxicated and given numerous charges including reckless driving and leaving the scene of an accident. As per John's Law, Zimmerman was released into the custody of a responsible party, which was established in 2001 under the name of "modernised" by the name "christ.
shortSummary: Two drivers were arrested for DWI in separate incidents in Hoboken, involving Bailee Zimmerman (not) and Karol Bacuilima (not).

scraped_sources.text:
Power was shut to the railway for hours early Sunday morning.
Teens with autism have been shot by law enforcement officers who didn't understand their disorder. A Hudson County program hopes to help.
Demonstrations and an entire block of bounce houses made kids smile at the annual National Night Out in Hoboken.
One person was injured and light rail service was suspended when a train crashed into a vehicle in Hoboken on Tuesday, NJ Transit said.
A detective was arrested at police headquarters Monday as part of an ongoing investigation into a Hudson County drug production facility.
A free bounce house, food, demonstrations, and sensory friendly activities are planned for Hoboken's National Night Out against crime.
A Union City man was arrested for having more than 1,000 images of child sex abuse on his device, prosecutors said.
The city of Hoboken will expand the Table of Organization to include more officers.
Police released a statement about a woman found dead in Hoboken on Wednesday evening.
A fire has caused power outages to parts of Hoboken and will cause more, the city said. Cooling centers are open.
A water line break has impacted two blocks of downtown Hoboken.
Five new Hoboken police officers were sworn in on Friday, 2 of whom are sons of past detectives.
A petition about a "pride mass" in Hoboken has amassed more than 90,000 signatures. Hoboken's police are ready, the city says.
The Hudson County Arson Task Force is investigating a fire that killed a man on Monday.
A man has been arrested for groping a pre-teen girl on a popular thoroughfare through Hudson County, prosecutors said.
A former Hoboken council candidate and longtime city director has been sentenced to prison, federal officials said Tuesday.
"Prepare for traffic delays this morning," said the city of Hoboken Thursday morning.
A 10-year-old girl disappeared from Jersey City. The NJ State Police released a video (below) that showed her at the mall with a man.
Several juveniles have been identified in connection with 4 robberies in Hoboken over the weekend, police said.
Divine Anyanwu is missing from Jersey City, police said.
A middle school staff member in Hudson County has been charged with sex crimes against 2 female students, prosecutors said Friday.
Police searched for someone in the Hudson River off Hoboken on Thursday night, and will continue Friday, a spokesperson said.
Investigators are searching for a hit-and-run driver who seriously injured a pedestrian in Hudson County, they said.
Why were fireworks going off on Wednesday? It's part of an annual celebration.
Some Hoboken schools are locked down, police said Monday afternoon.
22 suspects from Hoboken and Jersey City have been arrested in connection with a drug investigation at a Hoboken street corner, said police.
A Hoboken police officer watched a driver slam into parked cars, then found a gun in his car, police said.
Two kids were taken to Hoboken police headquarters Sunday after other children were hit by pellets from a gel gun, police said.
A man was charged for harassing two women at a Hoboken coffee house, police said.
Police are asking for help to identify the alleged scammers who were at a Hoboken park perpetrating a Zelle scheme.
A man was seriously injured in a three-car crash at a Hudson County intersection, prosecutors said.
Police released two photos of a "person of interest" they're seeking in connection with a Hoboken burglary, they said.
The city of Hoboken said to avoid the area near a water main break Thursday afternoon. Water service may be disrupted.
Hoboken police have charged 6 stores for allowing an underage, undercover officer to buy alcohol, they said.
A Genovese crime family leader has been granted "compassionate release" from prison at 95 and will live in North Jersey, reports say.
A woman was arrested, released, and taken into custody again two hours later in Hoboken, police said.
A man tried to kidnap a girl on a busy North Bergen street last week and held her for 2 minutes before anyone intervened, police said.
A Hudson County, NJ man was charged with trafficking a missing teen girl after he was pulled over on the Pennsylvania Turnpike, police said.
A Hoboken-bound NJ Transit train slammed into an SUV in Fair Lawn on Wednesday evening.
Hoboken police headed to the Bon Jovi rest area to arrest a man who was wanted for a 2022 assault in a local bar, they said.

argos_summary: On June 28, Officer Valentino Salgado arrested Bailee Zimmerman for driving while intoxicated after she crashed into a parked vehicle and attempted to flee. The following morning, Karol Bacuilima was also arrested for DUI after flipping her car while speeding and showing signs of intoxication. Both incidents highlight ongoing concerns about impaired driving in Jersey City.
